intro: Triumfetta bogotensis var. genuina, commonly known as the Bogotá triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The species is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. The plant is notable for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native habitat.
